description: Not long ago, inside the residence of Hawaiis last queen, Laura Bush stepped to a lectern and carefully pronounced the word Papahanaumokuakea. A cheer went up, the Halau Pua Alii Ilima dancers chanted and Honolulus important people took turns praising the first ladys pronunciation of the new name for the Northwestern Hawaiian Islands Marine National Monument, the largest protected marine area in the world and George W. Bushs only act of unabashed environmentalism. But amid the easy island music and Laura Bushs descriptions of the Laysan albatross (who mate for life), the significance of the monument felt buried. More than a native Hawaiian cultural heritage site, more than a nesting area for endangered albatrosses, Papahanaumokuakea represents something unique in U.S. conservation history: the first large-scale territorial victory of fish over fishermen.

title: Jailhouse Flock
description: The women-in-prison genre, even at its most blatantly exploitative, cant escape the political. The collective female experience, what were allowed and what were forbidden, is distilled into the image of rows of women behind bars doing time for crimes that often seem to be entangled in questions about gender and power  the much-beaten woman who finally kills the abusive husband or boyfriend, the prostitute, the drug mule for male gangsters, the mother who inexplicably murders her own children, the teacher who sleeps with her 13-year-old male student. Like a funhouse mirror, prison reflects and distorts the darkest impulses of women, and of the culture in which they maneuver. If your husband cheats on you, again, is it O.K. to run him over with your car a few times? If the tall boy in the junior high math class you teach says he loves you and you really, really love him, too, can you have his baby? If youve been repeatedly raped by your stepfather since you were 7, is it any surprise that you grow up to be murderously psychotic?

title: 36 Hours in St. Petersburg, Russia

No longer. Rechristened as St. Petersburg, the former Russian capital has recaptured much of its glamour and offers an enchanting landscape not only for lovers of culture but for their children as well. Adults can walk in the footsteps of Pushkin and Dostoevsky, Tchaikovsky and Shostakovich. But the city also has a slew of fantastical palaces, a rousing circus, one of the world's deepest subways and natives who eat pancakes for dinner. What child wouldn't be smitten by that? And if you visit during the summer, the sun barely sets, so there's plenty of time to play. Here's the only rub: getting the little ones to bed when there's still daylight.

Some in the audience swayed slightly in their chairs or wheelchairs, or clapped or nodded with the rhythm. Others simply watched; a few dozed despite the high decibels from the live singer and his synthesizer.

The couple, who rented an apartment on First Street, liked the neighborhood well enough, feeling reassured by the reputation of its schools and enjoying Prospect Park right next door. There was also the never-ending parade of shops and restaurants to try.

Am I ethically wrong not to tell them (or colleges or future employers) that I am paid for work they might assume is voluntary?  Anna Akullian, Berkeley, Calif.

Kennedys assassination, died Thursday at a hospice near his home in Englewood, N.J. He was 92.

description: If the thought of being trapped on a boat with your kids for a week is horrifying, but a day cruise and one-night island stay sounds about right, check out Discovery Cruise Lines special family offer (www.discoverycruiseline.com).

title: White and Hot From Spain
description: Americas imports of albarios from northwestern Spain leapt to one million liters in 2006 from 755,000 in 2005. The charming, appetite-whetting 2006 Martn Cdax, from Ras Baixas, on the Atlantic in Galicia, shows why these dry whites popularity is on the rise.

title: Alone
description: In her first three novels, including her marvelous debut, Dreaming in Cuban, Cristina Garca amply demonstrated her literary gifts, delineating fine gradations of love and hatred, madness and obsession, while juggling multiple narratives. Although she demonstrated a fondness for excess and magic, her stories remained firmly grounded in the insistent claims of the body  and in the recent history of her native country, Cuba. Her characters  whether good or bad, in exile or in Havana  also remained strongly linked to that small island nation.

title: Staring Down Risk
description: MY great-grandfather Montague is my inspiration. He was a slave in Virginia who had superior math skills. When the slave owner conducted business, he took Montague along to do calculations.

title: No One Says 9/11. No One Needs To.
description: ON Tina Feys NBC sitcom 30 Rock, recently, her character, the fictional NBC producer Liz Lemon, settles in with friends to watch the networks Salute to Fireworks in Rockefeller Plaza. As marching-band music plays, they see explosions and smoke rising over a monolithic high-rise tower in New York. Oh boy, Liz says dryly, thats going to scare a lot of people.

title: Friends Older and New
description: The restaurant scene that has thrived for years in Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn, remains vibrant. Three of these newer places have opened in the past year.

title: The Family Vacation, Reinvented
description: IT seems that a one-week trip to the shore, with days spent digging for clams and nights spent camping under the stars, has long ago ceased to be enough of a diversion for families planning their summer getaways. Now, the options range from cooking lessons in Italy (with even toddlers getting some kitchen time) to marionette-making courses in Prague to volunteer vacations that include trips to orphanages in China.

title: American Spy
description: By the summer of 1943, the tides of World War II seemed to be turning ever so slightly to the Allies' side. Earlier in the year, Hitler had been forced out of Stalingrad and Tunisia. The Allies landed in Sicily, bombed Rome, sent German troops scurrying out of Italy, and arrested Mussolini. But it was a tug of war. Hitler countered by invading Allied-occupied Italy, where he rescued Mussolini in the middle of September. If we were going to win this war, Uncle Sam needed every man he had, but I was twiddling my thumbs as a briefer to a paper-pushing general in sunny Orlando, Florida.

title: God Is Not Great
description: If the intended reader of this book should want to go beyond disagreement with its author and try to identify the sins and deformities that animated him to write it (and I have certainly noticed that those who publicly affirm charity and compassion and forgiveness are often inclined to take this course), then he or she will not just be quarreling with the unknowable and ineffable creator who-presumably-opted to make me this way. They will be defiling the memory of a good, sincere, simple woman, of stable and decent faith, named Mrs. Jean Watts.

title: The Big Girls
description: Sloatsburg Correctional Institution, a walled complex of seven large stone buildings, sits on the west bank of the Hudson River. An hour north of Manhattan by train, it was built in the late nineteenth century as a sanatorium for tuberculosis patients. Buildings A, B, and C hold five hundred prisoners of the federal government, all of them women. The remaining buildings are used for clinics, schoolrooms, the chapel, and administration as well as for the laundry, kitchens, library, and machine shop. There is a large plot of land behind Building A where the prisoners grow beans. A high brick wall with two wooden watchtowers occupied by men with rifles surrounds the prison on three sides. The river runs parallel to Building C on the east. There are no guardhouses along the river, which causes me to wonder. Do they think that black women can't swim?

title: The Yiddish Policemens Union
description: Nine months Landsman's been flopping at the Hotel Zamenhof without any of his fellow residents managing to get themselves murdered. Now somebody has put a bullet in the brain of the occupant of 208, a yid who was calling himself Emanuel Lasker.

title: How I Became a Nun
description: MY STORY, THE STORY of "how I became a nun," began very early in my life; I had just turned six. The beginning is marked by a vivid memory, which I can reconstruct down to the last detail. Before, there is nothing, and after, everything is an extension of the same vivid memory, continuous and unbroken, including the intervals of sleep, up to the point where I took the veil.

title: Nixon and Kissinger
description: In the nearly twenty years following his resignation from the presidency in 1974, Richard Nixon struggled to reestablish himself as a well-regarded public figure. He tried to counter negative views of himself by writing seven books, mostly about international relations, which could sustain and increase his reputation as a world statesman. Yet as late as 1992, he complained to Monica Crowley, a young postpresidential aide: "'We have taken ... ever since-insulted by the media as the disgraced former president.'"

title: The New Yorkers
description: We'll begin our story with Jody. She had lived on the block in her studio apartment since college, a luxurious accommodation at the time, certainly when compared to the dorm room she was leaving. After twenty years, the one room no longer struck her as luxurious, but the morning light was still lovely, the stabilized rent remained artificially low, and the large room with its beautiful bay window, high ceiling, and molding in the shape of twisted rope continued to be her home.

title: A Handbook to Luck
description: Enrique Florit climbed the stairs to the roof of his apartment building, which was eye level with the top of the street's jacaranda trees. It had rained that afternoon and dark puddles stained the cement and the peeling tar paper. When Enrique opened the doors of the wire-mesh cages, the doves fluttered to his shoulders and outstretched arms. Five months ago, he and his father had bought the doves and dyed their feathers a rainbow of pastels. Now Enrique poured their daily seed, freshened their water, listened to the low blue murmurings in their throats.

title: Ghostwalk
description: Over the last two years, as I have tried to tease out the truths from the untruths in that series of events that seeped out through Elizabeth's death, like lava moving upwards and outwards through salt water from a tear in the seabed, I have had to be you several times, Cameron Brown, in order to claw myself towards some kind of coherence. Sometimes it was-is-easy to imagine the world through your eyes, terribly possible to imagine walking through the garden that afternoon in those moments before you found your mother's body in the river. After all, for a long time, all that time we were lovers, it was difficult to tell where your skin ended and mine began. That was part of the trouble for Lydia Brooke and Cameron Brown. Lack of distance became-imperceptibly-a violent entanglement.

title: Angelica
description: I suppose my prescribed busywork should begin as a ghost story, since that was surely Constance's experience of these events. I fear, however, that the term arouses unreasonable expectations in you. I scarcely expect to frighten you of all people, even if you should read this by snickering candle and creaking floorboards. Or with me lying at your feet.

title: Kinfolks
description: My younger brother bill is clutching his teddy bear, the noose still knotted around its neck. My older brother John and I sit on a carpeted step in the front hallway as the gray-haired babysitter with crooked brown teeth informs us that the Melungeons will get us for having hung the bear from the upstairs landing, just out of Bill's reach in the downstairs hall.

title: Paperback Row
description: ABSURDISTAN, by Gary Shteyngart. (Random House, $13.95.) One of the Book Reviews top 10 books of 2006, Shteyngarts exuberant second novel introduces Misha Vainberg, the rap-music-obsessed, grossly overweight son of the 1,238th-richest man in Russia. After attending college in the United States and falling for a Bronx-bred woman named Rouenna, Misha is now stuck in St. Petersburg, scrambling for an American visa that may never arrive. He heads for Absurdsvan, an oil-rich former Soviet republic, hoping to buy a Belgian passport, and gets tangled up in local politics. Compared with most young novelists his age, Walter Kirn wrote here, Shteyngart is a giant mounted on horseback. He ranges more widely, sees more sweepingly and gets where hes going with far more aplomb.

title: Editors Choice
description: BECAUSE A FIRE WAS IN MY HEAD, by Lynn Stegner. (University of Nebraska, $24.95.) Stegners protagonist is a self-destructive hussy who leaves a crowd of broken people in her wake.

At first, few people seemed to know for sure if Mr. Giuliani and Mrs. Giuliani were a romantic item. But in the summer of 2001, almost a year after he publicly announced his divorce from his second wife, Donna Hanover, the relationship was made public in a cover story on People magazine.

Then to pilot the load, youll need a crew of people willing to be away from their families for two weeks at a time while working six-hour shifts around the clock. And youll need about a billion dollars worth of liability coverage.

Daoud is an incredible guy, and you can see little bits of him in this video from that same trip with him. Hes the tall Sudanese in the edge of some scenes.

title: Bank Files May Undercut Wolfowitz, Critics Say

Wolfowitz, the bank president, understood that his role in ordering a pay increase and promotion for his companion in 2005 might be seen as a conflict of interest but insisted on proceeding anyway, bank officials who are critics of Mr. Wolfowitz said Sunday.

title: Educating the Education Secretary

Thats what Education Secretary Margaret Spellings seemed to say while testifying before Congress last week about her departments failure to halt the payoffs, kickbacks and general looting of the public treasury by a lending company that collected nearly $300 million in undeserved subsidies. But that doesnt track with the federal Higher Education Act, which clearly authorizes the secretary to disqualify from federal programs lenders who employ payoffs, kickbacks and unethical practices like those that have been found to be commonplace in the college lending business.

title: Chrysler Group to Be Sold for $7.4 Billion
description: STUTTGART, Germany May 14  DaimlerChrysler confirmed today that it would sell a controlling interest in its struggling Chrysler Group to Cerberus Capital Management of New York, a private equity firm that specializes in restructuring troubled companies. The price being paid is $7.4 billion, mostly in the form of capital that Cerberus will put into Chrysler.

description: ONE of the most dreaded buying decisions is becoming still tougher. Auto manufacturers now sell about 280 different cars in the United States, up from 208 at the start of the decade. In five years that number is expected by market researchers to reach 340.

title: Three Women on the Verge of a Life-Changing Moment
description: Betrothed is a lovely and uneven work of theater. On the one hand, its a literally moving meditation on matrimony: not quite dance, not quite drama, weaving together three stories from very different sources (Jhumpa Lahiri, Anton Chekhov and S. Ansky) about women who are looking forward to marriage. Rachel Dickstein, the shows inventor and the founder of the company Ripe Time, has developed a distinctive stage language, simple yet effective, overlapping words with movement, poetic image with sound (the score is by the jazz pianist and composer Vijay Iyer). From the opening tableau of three women half-suspended within rectangular openings in the back wall, bathed in a haze of sepia light, while the cellist Greg Heffernan and the flutist Natacha Diels gently feel out lines of electronically enhanced music, its clear this is going to be a sensual, beautiful evening.

title: Maximalism, Minimalism and a Few Narratives Askew
description: Anyone who wanted a crash course in downtown dance currents could have spent several profitable evenings attending the recent La MaMa Moves! festival, where some 50 companies and choreographers have been presented over the last two weeks.

description: The University of Texas announced today that it had fired the director of financial aid at its Austin campus for improper conduct, saying that he had more ties to a student loan company than were previously known and had begun recommending the lender to students a few months after he purchased stock in its parent company.

title: A New Curator Casts a Fresh Eye on Architectures Past at MoMA
description: Stepping into the large shoes of Philip Johnson, the founding curator of MoMAs architecture department, might have seemed challenge enough for Barry Bergdoll, who took on the position in January. But he also had to contend with a weighty anniversary: the department turns 75 this year.

title: Corrections: For the Record
description: A sports article last Monday about Victory Challenges performance in the Americas Cup challengers series referred incorrectly to a past Cup competitor that was used as the model for a prized yacht of Jan Stenbeck, the founder of Victory Challenge. Endeavor, on which the prized yacht Sophie is based, challenged for  but did not win  the Americas Cup in 1934.

title: Amid Friction, Plans for U.S.-Iran Talks on Iraq
description: CAIRO, May 13  The diplomatic tussle between Iran and the United States intensified Sunday as leaders from both countries toured Middle Eastern capitals seeking to shore up relationships, even as signs of new cooperation over Iraq emerged between them.

title: Divided Over Trade
description: Nothing divides Democrats like international trade policy. That became clear last week, when the announcement of a deal on trade between Democratic leaders and the Bush administration caused many party activists to accuse the leadership of selling out.

title: Boy Killed as Overloaded Van Hits Pole in Northern Manhattan
description: The driver of an overloaded minivan lost control of the vehicle early yesterday on the Harlem River Drive in northern Manhattan, the police said, and one of 10 people on board, a 14-year-old boy, was killed when it hit a light pole.

title: U.S. Asks Europe to Ensure Continued Access to Air Passenger Data
description: VENICE, May 13  In order to reduce the odds that terrorists will enter the United States, the Bush administration is asking the European Union to lift its objections to the sharing of airline passenger information with American intelligence agencies, said the secretary of homeland security, Michael Chertoff.

title: Dancemakers Urgent Visions Echo in a Harlem Landmark
description: Part of the pleasure of E-Moves 8, which opened on Friday night at Harlem Stage at the Gatehouse, was the setting, a sensitively restored 1890 pumping station whose theater space and staff are instantly welcoming. But pieces like Ayo Janeen Jacksons Where Unicorns and Demons Play and Camille A. Browns Evolution of a Secured Feminine would probably look terrific even performed on a subway platform.

title: A Nod to Journalistic Integrity Is Seen in an Editors Return
description: Who says industry magazines are cozy with their advertisers?

title: More Than Advocacy (1 Letter)
description: To the Editor:

title: Hotel Chain Compromises With Publisher After Rejecting Book Over Language
description: The Ritz-Carlton chain is known for offering many fine services to its guests, and now it may be time to add book censorship to the list.

title: Prez Close Enough to Perfect for the Mets
description: When Mets Manager Willie Randolph strode toward the mound yesterday, the crowd at Shea Stadium booed every slow step. He took the baseball from his starter, Oliver Prez, who was only two outs from the end of a brilliant game, and no one wanted to see Prez go.

title: Renewed Violence Limits Oil Production in Nigerian Region
description: The violence that has gripped Nigerias main oil region for the last year is again on the rise after weeks of an uneasy truce.

title: Hes Taut of Style and Light of Foot
description: When Lee Child toured Britain early this spring for the release of his latest monster hit, Bad Luck and Trouble, certain fans were awarded reproductions of the folding toothbrush featured in the novel. It would take a hard-core fan to appreciate the humor in this. But there are many of those fans, for good reason.

title: Take a Class, Tweak Your Career
description: ON a typical Tuesday night at the Jewish Community Center on Manhattans Upper West Side, I sit at a table in what is normally a pre-school classroom with a psychologist, an interior designer, a nonprofit administrator, a few mothers eager to return to the work force and the requisite handful of lawyers looking to leave their law practice.

title: Is It the Woman Thing, or Is It Katie Couric?
description: The numbers are stark. Eight months into Katie Courics job as the first woman to anchor a network newscast on her own, her CBS Evening News has not only settled back into its long-held position of last among the evening news broadcasts, but also regularly falls short of the newscast that Ms. Couric replaced.

title: Matzs Chelokee Not Expected to Run in Preakness
description: The trainer Michael Matz said it was unlikely that Chelokee would compete in the Preakness Stakes on Saturday. Instead, Matz said his colt would run in the Barbaro Stakes, which is part of the undercard at Pimlico Race Course in Baltimore.

title: TV Viewing, Through the Lens of Politics
description: Viewers of the Fox News Channel were significantly more likely than the general population to call themselves Republicans, according to data released last week by Scarborough Research, the consumer research firm.

title: Mylan Labs in Deal to Buy German Generic Drug Unit
description: Mylan Laboratories has agreed to buy the generic drug unit of Merck, the German drug maker, for 4.9 billion euros ($6.7 billion) in cash.

title: Japan Sets Referendum on Pacifist Constitution
description: TOKYO, May 14  The Japanese government took an important step toward revising its pacifist Constitution today when the countrys parliament endorsed a national referendum on the issue.

title: Corrections: For the Record
description: A dance review on April 16 about the Boris Eifman Ballet, at City Center, misstated the history of Mr. Eifmans new ballet, The Seagull. Its American premiere was in March at the University of California, Berkeley  not at City Center in April.

title: Offensive Struggle Catches Up to the Yankees
description: SEATTLE, May 13  The Yankees have fallen so far behind the Boston Red Sox that every game seems to take on urgency, even this early in the season. That is what made their Sunday so discouraging.

title: Going Nine for Nine in Nevada on the Way to a Teams Title
description: The John Roberts Teams opened the Cavendish Invitational tournament that began on Wednesday at the Green Valley Ranch Resort in Henderson, Nev., and ended yesterday. The winners ended with a perfect record of played nine, won nine. They were Drew Casen of Las Vegas; Neil Chambers of Schenectady, N.Y.; John Diamond and Jim Krekorian of New York; Gaylor Kasle of Boca Raton, Fla.; and John Schermer of Seattle.

title: Bowens Defense Earns Him More Scrutiny
description: SAN ANTONIO, May 14  Bruce Bowen has made a career of frustrating opponents with his tenacious defense while provoking their suspicion -- if not outrage. In three games of this testy Western Conference semifinal series against the Phoenix Suns, the Spurs forward has managed to do both, but has yet to incur a major penalty from the N.B.A.

title: Sitcoms Are Dead! Long Live Sitcoms!
description: NETWORK television isnt dead.

title: G.O.P. May Be Losing Patience With State Chairmans Scarcity
description: ALBANY  Discontent is rising with Joseph N. Mondello, the states Republican Party chairman, ahead of the partys New York City fund-raiser on Thursday featuring John McCain and Rudolph W. Giuliani.

title: Battle Over Same-Sex Marriage Reaches Connecticuts Highest Court
description: HARTFORD, May 14  The battle over same-sex marriage reached Connecticuts highest court today, with judges confronting two basic questions during oral arguments: Does the state law that provides for civil unions for same-sex couples create a fundamentally inferior status for gays and lesbians, compared with marriage? And do homosexuals constitute a class of people with special protection against discrimination under state law?

title: Pap y Yo, Speaking Our Rebel Minds
description: Most people dont know their parents as well as they think they do, partly because children must rely on eyewitnesses to help them understand those crucial, early years. But more important, theres the issue of critical distance, which is why family members dont always make the best biographers. In Daughter of a Cuban Revolutionary, at DR2 Theater, Marissa Chibas, who also stars in this standard-issue solo show, at least has the benefit of a fascinating family.

title: Manhattan: Motorcyclist Killed
description: A motorcyclist was thrown to the pavement and killed yesterday after she struck a man who had run into traffic on the West Side Highway at 56th Street in Manhattan, the police said. The woman, whose name was not released but who was said to be in her 30s, was traveling north on the highway shortly after 9:30 a.m. when the crash took place, the authorities said, even though she applied her brakes and swerved to try to avoid a collision. The man suffered a broken leg, the police said. The police did not release the pedestrians name.

title: 2 Sides Give Opening Arguments in Padilla Trial
description: MIAMI, May 14  The trial of Jose Padilla and two co-defendants charged with conspiring to support terrorism opened today with government lawyers describing what they called a calculated plan to provide money, equipment and recruits to Al Qaeda and, in Mr. Padillas case, train to become a terrorist.

title: Looking Ahead
description: ECONOMIC INDICATORS Reports this week will provide data on consumers. The government releases its consumer inflation report, and the Labor Department reports the Consumer Price Index for April (Tuesday) and weekly jobless claims (Thursday). The University of Michigan releases its consumer sentiment index on Friday.

title: Key Taliban Leader Is Killed in Afghanistan in Joint Operation
description: KANDAHAR, Afghanistan, May 13  The man who probably was the Talibans foremost operational commander, Mullah Dadullah, was killed in a joint operation by Afghan security forces, American forces and NATO troops in Helmand Province, Governor Asadullah Khaled of the neighboring Kandahar Province said Sunday.

title: NBC Will Bring Back All Three Law & Order Shows
description: NBC Universal has made a last-minute deal to retain all three of its long-running Law & Order series, shifting one, Law & Order: Criminal Intent, to its entertainment cable channel, the USA Network, for the first run of new episodes.

description: Accounts

title: Last Call in Baseball Clubhouses, but Few Players Seem to Mind
description: There are two glass-door refrigerators in the narrow visitors clubhouse at Yankee Stadium. One is filled with bottled water and juices, while the other has a more varied selection: sports drinks, protein shakes, soda, diet soda, lemonade and chocolate milk.

title: College Outside the Class: Advanced Studies in Tharp
description: The eagerly anticipated College Showcase: Works by Tharp, presented Saturday afternoon at the Joyce Theater, provided a fascinating look into 1970s choreography by Twyla Tharp and her style and compositional methods. The afternoon also suggested a few things about programming and the high level of university dance training today, seen here in students from Barnard, Hunter, Marymount Manhattan and Sarah Lawrence Colleges, as well as the Juilliard Schools student professionals. The urge to include all four of the colleges was understandable, but having two segments of The Fugue was overkill.

title: A Fresh Start on Energy
description: Congresss last effort to craft a decent energy strategy, in 2005, was largely disappointing. But at the risk of getting our hopes up once again, we call attention to two promising bills making their way to the Senate floor. Stapled together, they could make a constructive start toward reducing this countrys dependence on oil imports and its emissions of greenhouse gases.

title: Obama Says Hed Roll Back Tax Cuts for the Wealthiest
description: WASHINGTON, May 13  If elected president, Senator Barack Obama said Sunday, he would seek to repeal President Bushs tax cuts for the wealthiest Americans and use the money to pay for health care, but he did not suggest he would raise other taxes to pay for expanded services.

title: Psychoanalyzing Our Leaders (2 Letters)
description: To the Editor:

title: The Pope Denounces Capitalism and Marxism
description: APARECIDA, Brazil, May 13  In a major speech on Sunday, Pope Benedict XVI condemned capitalism and Marxism as systems that marginalize God and urged the Latin American clergy to feed peoples spiritual hunger as the way to ease poverty and halt the Roman Catholic Churchs steady decline in the region.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 3,377 American service members who have died since the start of the Iraq war. It confirmed the death of following American on Friday:

title: A Virtuoso of Imagination Glories in Connected Dots
description: Every distinguished artist who has been chosen to present a series of Perspectives concerts at Carnegie Hall has used the opportunity to make connections among music of different styles and eras. But no one has taken this kind of exploration to the exhilarating extremes of the brilliant French pianist Pierre-Laurent Aimard this season at Carnegie Hall.

title: Palestinian Interior Minister Resigns
description: GAZA CITY, Gaza Strip, May 14  The Palestinian interior minister, Hani al-Qawasmeh, resigned today, as four more Palestinians were killed in fierce factional gun battles.

title: Briton Bullish on Buying Small Newspapers in Europe
description: LONDON, May 13  As Rupert Murdoch trains his sights on Dow Jones & Company, owner of The Wall Street Journal, another veteran of the British newspaper wars is betting on the future of lower-profile print publications.

title: Engine Woes Fail to Slow Hendrick Teams Streak
description: DARLINGTON, S.C., May 13  From week to week, California to Carolina, the locations change, but the story lines continue to repeat themselves in Nascars one-sided Nextel Cup series.

title: Violence Puts More Pressure on Musharraf
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, May 13  A day after political clashes claimed 39 lives in Karachi, analysts said the violence  and accusations that the government had done little to stop the killings  had put renewed pressure on the president, Gen. Pervez Musharraf.

title: For This Troop, No Battles but Plenty of Brass
description: Joseph N. Mondello, the chairman of New York States Republican Party, was a corporal in the United States Army when he was honorably discharged in 1958. But now, in the New York Guard, he is a two-star general.

title: Ground Zero Illnesses Clouding Giulianis Legacy
description: Anyone who watched Rudolph W. Giuliani preside over ground zero in the days after 9/11 glimpsed elements of his strength: decisiveness, determination, self-confidence.

title: Mets Pelfrey Is Sent to the Minors
description: The Mets sent the right-handed starter Mike Pelfrey to Class AAA New Orleans yesterday, in hopes that he will be able to resume throwing his fastball much lower in the strike zone and can rummage up some lost confidence.

title: Corrections: For the Record
description: A picture caption on Wednesday with an art review of The Sculpture of Louise Nevelson: Constructing a Legend, at the Jewish Museum, reversed the credits. The photograph of First Personage was from the Brooklyn Museum, and the picture of Mrs. N.s Palace was from the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: Jordans King Calls Off Visit to the West Bank
description: RAMALLAH, West Bank, May 13  A rare visit to the West Bank by King Abdullah II of Jordan was called off at the last minute on Sunday because of bad weather, Palestinian officials said, and in Gaza, serious fighting between Palestinian factions continued.

title: Giving Players a Choice and a Chance to Play
description: Two hours before his Detroit Pistons were scheduled to take on the Chicago Bulls in the fourth game of their Eastern Conference semifinal series, Amir Johnson stood in the middle of the Pistons locker room trying to hold a telephone conversation. You could sense the excitement in Johnsons voice. Although he wouldnt be in uniform, he is living the life and the dream of an N.B.A. player. At age 20 (he celebrated his 20th birthday on May 1), Johnson has seen much of the underside of the N.B.A., and a glimpse of the glory.

title: Corrections: For the Record
description: An article on Wednesday about the annual New York City sewage workers competition misstated part of the name of an organization of wastewater professionals that founded a national competition, the Operations Challenge, to which New York States winners will progress. It is the Water Environment Federation, not Foundation.

title: Trying to Keep the Viewers When the Ads Come On
description: As the big agencies get ready for the biggest week of the year for the biggest advertising medium, changes are coming that can only be called, well, big.

title: Torre Hustling Home to Spend Day Off With Ailing Brother
description: SEATTLE, May 13  Joe Torre will spend the Yankees day off Monday at New York-Presbyterian/Columbia hospital with his brother Frank, who is recovering from a kidney transplant.

title: Strike to Protest 39 Deaths Shuts Down Karachi
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, May 14  Opposition parties shut down the southern port city of Karachi and slowed commerce in other parts of the country with a strike on Monday to protest the deaths of at least 39 people in political violence over the weekend.

title: The Danger in Drug Kickbacks
description: The explosion in the use of three anti-anemia drugs to treat cancer and kidney patients illustrates much that is wrong in the American pharmaceutical marketplace. Thanks to big payoffs to doctors, and reckless promotional ads permitted by lax regulators, the drugs have reached blockbuster status. Now we learn that the dosage levels routinely injected or given intravenously in doctors offices and dialysis centers may be harmful to patients.

title: Atomic Agency Concludes Iran Is Stepping Up Nuclear Work
description: VIENNA, May 14  Inspectors for the International Atomic Energy Agency have concluded that Iran appears to have solved most of its technological problems and is now beginning to enrich uranium on a far larger scale than before, according to the agencys top officials.

title: Mickelson Is Star Pupil at Players Championship
description: PONTE VEDRA BEACH, Fla., May 13  The transformation of Phil Mickelson began away from microphones and cameras, on deserted driving ranges and under the eye of new management.

title: Got Reggae: Marley and Marley (and Marley, Too)
description: For brand recognition, the best family name in popular music may well be Marley. Bob Marleys reggae hits are instant singalongs for multiple generations of listeners worldwide  feel-good music that lets fans equate dance grooves and ganja smoke with political and spiritual righteousness.

title: U.S. Forces Search Iraq Area for 3 Missing Soldiers
description: BAGHDAD, May 13  About 4,000 American ground troops, supported by surveillance aircraft, attack helicopters and spy satellites, swept towns and farmland south of Baghdad on Sunday, searching for three American soldiers who disappeared Saturday after their patrol was ambushed, military officials said.

title: Accused of Plagiarism, Magazine Withdraws Issue
description: After being accused by Radar magazine of stealing an article, the Chilean magazine Cosas said it had been hoodwinked by a reporter and had withdrawn the issue from newsstands.

title: Germanys Governing Coalition Suffers Losses in Regional Election
description: BERLIN, May 13  Germanys governing coalition of conservatives and Social Democrats suffered big losses on Sunday in a regional election in the northern port of Bremen, as three opposition parties, particularly the new Left Party, made significant gains.

description: Do these Mets appreciate their opportunity to be one of the most memorably nicknamed teams in baseball history?

title: A Producer and an Ex-Prosecutor in a Trial by TV
description: The most disturbing spectacle at the trial of Phil Spector isnt the wizened and peculiar defendant slumped in the courtroom dressed in a 1970s-style leisure suit and blond pageboy wig. Its the parade of attractive, mature women shown on Court TV testifying that not so long ago they too were willing, even eager, to spend time with the once-legendary record producer.

title: A Mom Running to Lead the Mommy Party
description: Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton chose to mark Mothers Day a couple of days early this year, on Friday in New Hampshire, at an event with families to decry the lack of health insurance for millions of American children.

description: FRANKFURT, May 13  DaimlerChrysler appears close to selling the struggling Chrysler Group to a private equity firm that specializes in restructuring troubled companies, unwinding a 1998 merger that was meant to create a trans-Atlantic automotive powerhouse, people with direct knowledge of the discussions said on Sunday.

title: Deaths of Skiers Cousin and Officer Divide a Town

The family is famous in the region for questioning authority, and Millers rise to the top of his sport extended the familys outlaw mystique.

title: Whats on Tonight
description: 9 P.M. (CBS) THE KING OF QUEENS In this two-part series finale, the Heffernans teeter on the brink of disaster after Doug (Kevin James, above) discovers that Carrie (Leah Remini, above) didnt get rid of her apartment in the city after all. But then they receive a phone call that will change their lives.

description: A theater entry in the Listings pages of Weekend on Friday about Gayfest NYC, which presents the works of emerging gay playwrights, misstated the middle initial of one of the festivals producers. He is Jack W. Batman, not Jack R.

description: Last week, Michael R. Bloomberg, the New York City mayor, stood on a sunny public school terrace in Queens and told reporters that he was not running for president.

description: MOSCOW, May 13  Parliamentary elections in Armenia largely complied with international standards, Western election observers said Sunday, in the first positive assessment of an election in the former Soviet republic since it gained independence in 1991.

title: Mosques Are Shaken by Ties to a Plot
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 11  On the southern wall of the Al-Aqsa Islamic Society here is a mural painted by local schoolchildren. In 18 different languages  from Arabic to Swahili  it depicts the worlds various ways of saying love, hope and peace.

title: U.S. Soldier Shot to Death in Pakistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan, May 14  An American soldier was shot dead and four other Americans were wounded in Pakistan today after a meeting among Afghan, Pakistani and NATO officials at the Afghan-Pakistan border Afghan and NATO officials said. The meeting had been called to try to resolve recent clashes between the two neighboring countries

title: Consumers Take a Break
description: Consumer spending has been the powerful and dependable engine of the current economic expansion. Americans have continued to shop through boom-time borrowing, high oil prices, on-and-off job growth, uncontrolled medical costs, rampant trade deficits, hurricanes and war.

title: Smoke From Fires Closes 2 Highways
description: LAKE CITY, Fla., May 13 (AP)  Interstates 75 and 10 in north Florida were briefly reopened on Sunday before dense smoke from wildfires led the authorities to close them again.

description: WASHINGTON, May 14  Paul J. McNulty, the deputy attorney general whose Congressional testimony in February provided a spark that turned a smoldering issue over the firings of federal prosecutors into a raging inferno, announced his resignation this afternoon.

description: Deborah Voigts recital at Carnegie Hall on Friday was operatic, even with no opera on her program. Ms. Voigt, the American soprano, and her pianist, Brian Zeger, offered among other items Mozarts mouthful Die Ihr des Unermesslichen Weltalls Schpfer Ehrt. Later came Strausss Lied der Frauen and some Verdi, too.

title: Passaic: 2-Year-Old Left in Car Overnight
description: The father of a 2-year-old was charged yesterday with endangering the welfare of a child after he left his son locked in a parked car overnight, the police said. The father, Daniel Ribot, 32, took the boy, Adonis, to his second birthday party on Saturday night in Paterson. About 2:30 a.m. yesterday, the man placed the sleeping child inside his black Lexus parked at a gas station lot in Passaic, not far from the party, said Lt. Luis Guzman of the Passaic Police Department. When Mr. Ribot woke up in his Clifton home at 11:30 a.m., he realized he was missing both his child and his car, Lieutenant Guzman said. Mr. Ribot called the police in Clifton, who called the police in Passaic. The Passaic police found the car with Adonis screaming inside it, Lieutenant Guzman said. The police said they were still investigating and Mr. Ribot could face further charges.

description: CHICAGO, May 13  Continuing his effective play during the playoffs, Luol Deng played a major role Sunday in saving the Chicago Bulls season.

description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (Bloomberg News)  Senator Chuck Hagel, a Nebraska Republican, said Sunday that his party had been hijacked by a group of single-minded, almost isolationist insulationists, power-projectors.

description: MINNEAPOLIS, May 13  Last Thursday afternoon, more than a hundred employees of The Star Tribune in Minneapolis took to the small park across the street, many of then dressed in black or wearing black armbands in what they said was an act of mourning.

Fourteen years ago, when Rene Javier Perez decided to leave his impoverished hometown in eastern Guatemala in search of a more prosperous life in the United States, his parents mortgaged the plot of land where they lived to raise $3,000 he needed for a smuggler to lead him across the border.

description: Progress by September  that was the latest mandate from some nervous Republicans to President Bush over the war in Iraq. However, nobody in Washington seems to agree on what progress actually means  or how, precisely, it might be measured.

description: AUBURN HILLS, Mich., May 14  DaimlerChrysler reached an agreement early today to sell the struggling Chrysler Group to Cerberus Capital Management, a private equity firm that specializes in restructuring troubled companies, for $7.4 billion.

title: Chryslers Real Price: Less Than Zero
description: DaimlerChrysler confirmed Monday that it would sell a controlling interest in its struggling Chrysler Group to Cerberus Capital Management of New York, a private equity firm that specializes in restructuring troubled companies. The price being paid is $7.4 billion, mostly in the form of capital that Cerberus will put into Chrysler. Of that sum, DaimlerChrylser itself will receive only $1.3 billion, and the German automaker said Monday that the transaction will actually result in a net cash outflow of about $678 million.

title: From Obi-Wan to Othello
description: Ewan McGregor, who makes millions from playing Obi-Wan Kenobi in the "Star Wars" films and other screen roles, will take the minimum wage  $790 week  when he returns to the stage this fall as the villainous Iago at the Donmar Warehouse in London in a new production of Shakespeare's "Othello," The Associated Press reported.

title: Buyout Shop Swallows Sams Wine and Spirits
description: Family control of Sams Wines and Spirits has ended with a deal announced Friday to sell 80 percent of the third-generation business to a Chicago private-equity firm. The deal with buyout shop Arbor Investments provides Sams with access to capital that would allow it to expand at a time when Internet sales are putting pressure on wine-and-spirits stores.

title: Russian Billionaire Buys Stake in Lyondell Chemical
description: News that a Russian-born billionaire is buying a stake in Houstons Lyondell Chemical fueled an 11 percent surge in shares of the company on Friday in anticipation of a possible takeover.

title: Compass Sells Vending Unit to Allianz
description: Stockholders of Compass, the catering company, are to receive a further 500 million pound ($991 million) payout as a result of the companys sale of its Selecta vending business for 772.5 million pounds to the private equity arm of Allianz.

title: Indian Beer Magnate Sets Sights on Scottish Whiskey
description: The Scottish whiskey distiller Whyte & Mackay is about to become the latest target of Indias growing global aspirations. Vijay Mallya, the Indian beer magnate, is expected to sign a deal to buy Whyte & Mackay this week, according to The International Herald Tribune.

description: Scientists are putting the final touches on a 17-mile-long particle accelerator that will attempt to create forces and particles that existed shortly after the Big Bang.

description: Tesla Motors, the Silicon Valley electric-car start-up, said Friday that it had raised an additional $45 million  from a venture capital firm as well as its chairman. Buzz surrounding the surrounding the company, which will start producing its first vehicle, a zero-emissions, two-seat roadster, later this year, is already deafening, with a list of high-profile buyers already lining up to snag a model.

title: Defending the Orbitz I.P.O.
description: A number of analysts and industry watchers are predicting that Orbitz Worldwides $750 million initial public offering will end in tears, as DealBook noted Friday. Among the reasons that detractors think the online travel sites I.P.O. will flop are its complex financial arrangements with its parent, Travelport, as well as the companys history of losses.

description: More company executives may face criminal charges as a result of ongoing federal investigations into stock-option backdating, the Securities and Exchange Commission Chairman, Christopher Cox, said Friday. We have a substantial number of investigations under way [including] cases that are maturing to the point of potential criminal action, Mr. Cox told reporters at a securities conference.

title: Everquest I.P.O. Highlights Bear Stearns Subprime Bets
description: The initial public offering of Everquest, a fledgling financial-services company, is a blatant attempt by Bear Stearns to unload its mortgage bets on unwitting retail investors, argues BusinessWeeks Matthew Goldstein.
