description: Washington

title: Whats on Tonight
description: 8 P.M. (NBC) DEAL OR NO DEAL Wesley Autrey Sr., the New York construction worker who jumped on the subway tracks in January to save the life of a stranger, plays for the $1 million top prize in this special episode. (Mr. Autrey is left above, with the shows host, Howie Mandel.)

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 3,397 American service members who have died since the start of the Iraq war. It confirmed the deaths of the following Americans over the weekend:

title: Two Are Killed and 32 Hurt in Crash of Bus Bound for Chinatown
description: Two people were killed and 32 injured yesterday when a bus bound from Chicago to Chinatown in New York City crashed in the early morning on a rainy interstate in western Pennsylvania, the authorities said.

title: Final Homecoming
description: Once upon a time, sweatshirts and pennants sufficed as markers of school spirit. And while more than a few Fighting Irish fans would be happy to have their final resting place under the 50-yard line at Notre Dame Stadium, most university devotees have understood the difference between a college and a cemetery. But the line is beginning to blur.

title: 8 Killed as Israel Hits a Hamas Politicians Gaza Home
description: JERUSALEM, May 20  The Israeli Air Force struck the home of a Hamas Parliament member in Gaza on Sunday night, killing eight people, Palestinian hospital officials said. The Parliament member, Khalil al-Hayya, was not in the house at the time.

title: A Lifeline for the Parks
description: We have had our quarrels with Dirk Kempthorne, the interior secretary, on policy questions involving endangered species as well as other issues. But when it comes to the national parks, he has brought good ideas and real follow-through to an administration that has been long on promises to the parks and annoyingly short on results.

title: Pitching Change Intended to Save Young Players Arms
description: Toeing the pitching rubber, 10-year-old Anthony Service glared toward home plate for a sign from his catcher in a tense one-run game this month in the Valley Stream Little League on Long Island. He did not get the signal he wanted. Anthony was coming out of the game because he had already thrown 75 pitches, the limit for him under Little League rules introduced this year.

title: Mozart for Instruments, Voices and Bodies
description: In an age of electronic scores and purposefully pedestrian movement, there are certainly moments when one pines for live music and actual steps. But if Christopher Cainess new program proves anything at all, its that live music and ballet steps are no guarantees of success.

title: Steinbrenner Gives Torre Message of Support
description: The last time the Yankees struggled against a prominent rival, at the end of April, they were losing badly to the Boston Red Sox and the principal owner, George Steinbrenner, was considering whether to fire Manager Joe Torre. Not so this past weekend.

title: Manhattan: Fire Ruins Midtown Pizzeria
description: A fire destroyed a Midtown pizzeria yesterday morning, sending five firefighters and one civilian to the hospital with minor injuries, the Fire Department said. The fire was reported at 11:29 a.m. in a building housing Abitinos Pizzeria, on First Avenue near 52nd Street. When firefighters arrived, the first three floors of the five-story building were ablaze, and it took them about an hour to put out the fire, Deputy Chief Thomas McKavanagh said. Dominick Abitino, one of three brothers who opened the restaurant in 1992 along with their father, said, Its a family business, and were all sad here.

title: Finding His Footing on Clay, Federer Ends Nadals Run
description: HAMBURG, Germany, May 20 (AP)  Roger Federer had the perfect response to questions about his status as the worlds top-ranked player: He ended Rafael Nadals 81-match winning streak on clay.

title: From Beaches to Pine Barrens, a Study Puts Values on New Jerseys Natural Assets
description: The New Jersey Pine Barrens are known for a lot of things: ghostly legends of a bat-winged Jersey Devil; weekend canoeing among mossy bogs; a place where Tony Soprano and company like to dump their dead.

title: Pitch by Pitch, the Yankees Mood Brightens
description: The tower atop the Empire State Building will glow blue and orange for a few hours this evening. The Mets earned that honor by winning the first two games of their series against the Yankees, but their supremacy in the city is not quite complete.

title: Honduran Diplomat Assails Police in Shooting of Unarmed Bronx Man
description: Appearing at a sidewalk memorial for an unarmed driver shot dead by an off-duty officer in the Bronx, the senior Honduran diplomat in New York criticized the police yesterday, saying, We are not going to let this go by unnoticed.

title: One Catch Has Changed Everything for Chvez
description: Endy Chvezs final encounter with baseball anonymity came in October, less than two hours after the St. Louis Cardinals bounced his Mets from the playoffs.

title: To the Glee of South Korean Fans, a Games Sequel Is Announced
description: Much of South Korea and gamers around the world spun into a tizzy over the weekend as Blizzard Entertainment, perhaps the worlds most successful video game company, announced that it was developing a sequel to its popular computer strategy game StarCraft.

title: Supreme Court Rules on Education Lawsuits
description: WASHINGTON, May 21  The Supreme Court ruled today that parents of children with disabilities need not hire lawyers if they want to sue public school districts over their childrens special-education needs.

title: A Musical Star Plucked From the Underground
description: In Passing Strange, an idiosyncratic and vibrant new musical that opened last week at the Public Theater, an ensemble of stunning young actors is almost overshadowed by the mesmerizing stage presence of a chubby, bald, moon-faced, middle-aged performer named Stew.

title: Wife of Idaho Gunman Is Found Dead
description: The wife of the gunman who killed two people and wounded others before killing himself in a shooting rampage in Moscow, Idaho, over the weekend has been added to the casualty list. Her body was found in their home, police said, according to broadcast and online news reports from local news media and reports by the Associated Press.

title: G.O.P. Senator Says Gonzales Might Quit
description: WASHINGTON, May 20  Senator Arlen Specter, the senior Republican on the Judiciary Committee, said Sunday that Attorney General Alberto R. Gonzales might resign rather than face a potential no-confidence vote in the Senate.

title: Looking Ahead
description: CHINA TRADE TALKS A high-level delegation from China visits the United States this week for a second round of talks aimed at easing trade tensions. The meetings on Tuesday and Wednesday will be the second session of the Strategic Economic Dialogue, which the two countries began in December in Beijing. The Chinese delegation will be led by Vice Premier Wu Yi, right.

title: Street Sense and Curlin May Not Meet Again Until Travers
description: The first two legs of the 2007 Triple Crown are in the books, and the races left horse enthusiasts with little to complain about. In the Kentucky Derby, Street Sense exploded down the stretch for a victory that validated his credentials as a champion. In the Preakness Stakes on Saturday, he made a similar move, only to be run down by a colt named Curlin in a heart-pounding stretch drive.

title: After Aiding Bill on Immigration, Employers Balk
description: WASHINGTON, May 20  Employers, who helped shape a major immigration bill over the last three months, said on Sunday that they were unhappy with the result because it would not cure the severe labor shortages they foresee in the coming decade.

title: Wayward Humpback Pair Moves Toward Ocean
description: WEST SACRAMENTO, Calif., May 20  The pilgrimage, for some, begins at dawn. They travel by foot, bicycle, scooter and even wheelchair to camp along a dusty riverbank facing a homely industrial port.

title: A Battered Siemens Names a New Chief
description: MUNICH, May 20 (Bloomberg News)  Siemens, Europes largest engineering company, named Peter Lscher, an executive of the American drug maker Merck, as its chief executive, to succeed Klaus Kleinfeld, who resigned after less than three years because of a bribery investigation on his watch.

title: Different Uniform, but Same Cheers for Dr. Williams
description: The graduates had filed into the Theater at Madison Square Garden, and as the screech of bagpipes accompanied the procession of Iona Colleges administration and faculty members toward the flower-rimmed stage yesterday, Bernie Williams, with that familiar shy smile and taller than most in a black robe and with a gold tassel swinging from his black mortarboard, returned to public life for about two hours.

title: Relievers Spirits Sink After Best Pitch Doesnt
description: Next week, Scott Schoeneweiss wife and three children will join him for the summer, and he cant wait to see them.

title: Growing Pains Galore for Toyota in First Year
description: Whatever exuberance Toyota and its teams brought to Daytona International Speedway in February for the season-opening race is long gone. So is the fear that Toyota, the first foreign brand to compete in Nascars premier series since the 1950s, would come into the Nextel Cup this year with an open wallet and buy its way into victory lane.

title: In a Time of High Anxiety, a Sedative of the Occult
description: The coming television season looks as if executives at the big broadcast networks might have turned over the creation of their schedules to the Munsters, the Addams family and Rod Serling  with an assist from Darrin, the adman on Bewitched.

title: Visitors From San Francisco Burnish a European Patina
description: Europeans like to call American orchestras brilliant and heartless and their own warm and cuddly. In places like Chicago and Cleveland clichs like this are embraced and transcended, with precision of gesture transformed into exquisite musicality. Visitors from the old country, on the other hand, might feel right at home in San Francisco, where the San Francisco Symphony under Michael Tilson Thomas has come to sound something like a high-end voice from across the sea. Capital cities in Central Europe might be happy with Americans like these to call their own.

title: Page Six Covers Itself, a Bit Painfully
description: If you were a member of the Bancroft family in the midst of deciding whether to sell Dow Jones & Company to Rupert Murdoch, reading Fridays New York Post might have made you choke on your bagel.

title: Return to the Final Four a Family Affair for Duke
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., May 20  When Dukes 19-11 victory against North Carolina in an N.C.A.A. tournament quarterfinal was complete, Blue Devils attackman Matt Danowski made a beeline toward his father, Coach John Danowski, and wrapped him in a bear hug. The father patted his sons head and smiled as the Duke fans among the 10,438 at Navy-Marine Corps Memorial Stadium celebrated.

title: Gay Britons Serve in Military With Little Fuss, as Predicted Discord Does Not Occur
description: LONDON, May 20  The officer, a squadron leader in the Royal Air Force, felt he had no choice. So he stood up in front of his squad of 30 to 40 people.

title: A Splash of Photo History Comes to Light
description: At first glance the two pictures seem to be gorgeous anachronisms, full-color blasts from the black-and-white world of 1908, the year Ford introduced the Model T and Theodore Roosevelt was nearing the end of his second term.

title: 7 U.S. Soldiers Die in Iraq, 6 in Sweep of Baghdad
description: BAGHDAD, May 20  Six American soldiers and their interpreter were killed by a roadside bomb in western Baghdad on Saturday, the military said Sunday, in one of the deadliest single attacks against American troops in the capital in recent months.

title: Ochoa Gets a Victory to Match Her Ranking
description: CLIFTON, N.J., May 20  On her drive to Upper Montclair Country Club, Lorena Ochoa said she saw sunshine and blue skies. She faced a two-shot deficit going into the final round of the Sybase Classic, but she said she was happy.

title: Ducks Last-Minute Goal Leads to Overtime Win
description: DETROIT, May 20 (AP)  The Anaheim Ducks were within a minute of losing a game that could have led to the end of their season.

title: Only Hope Is That Its Not Too Late in the Bronx
description: The Yankees never ask for sympathy, and in many places they do not get it. Even the interleague schedule works against them, having put them up against the Mets when they could least afford it.

title: Those Mischievous Looks Are Not at All Deceiving
description: A note to future concertgoers: When Devin the Dude promises to do one for the ladies, dont expect a love song. Expect instead a laundry list of impertinent anatomical questions, shyly delivered by a skinny, smiley, bug-eyed rapper who loves to sing. Somehow a dirty joke from Devin is much more charming than your average love song, and he proved it on Friday night at the Knitting Factory.

title: Lebanon Pounds Refugee Camp; Fighting Kills 60
description: TRIPOLI, Lebanon, May 21  Lebanese tanks and artillery pounded a Palestinian refugee camp in this northern Lebanese city for the second straight day on Monday, trying to trap members of a radical Islamist group and raising concerns for thousands of Palestinians inside the camp.

title: Suicide Bomber Kills at Least 10 at Market in Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan, May 20  At least 10 people were killed and 32 were wounded Sunday when a suicide bomber struck at a crowded market in the southeastern province of Paktia, the provincial police chief said. News agencies said the death toll later rose to 14, quoting doctors at the local hospital.

title: Tick-Tock and Other Pulses of the West
description: Back in the days of the early Middle Ages when sand and water and shadow were used to tell time, before there were mechanical clocks or eyeglasses or great cathedrals or steam engines, China was the worlds leading technological culture, able to best the provincial Europeans by nearly any measure. Three of the most important new materials that made their way into Europe from the 13th to the 15th century were paper, cast iron and gunpowder, each of which had probably been invented in China, each of which also was a fundamental resource for the development of Western civilization.

title: Legends of Life and Art, Stravinsky and Balanchine
description: If wealth of choreography is your main criterion, New York City Ballet should be the envy of the world this spring. By any standard except perhaps its own, the density with which it keeps adding ballets to its repertory is staggering.

title: Firefox and the Anxiety of Growing Pains
description: IF the open-source software movement were an upstart political campaign, Chris Messina would be one of its community organizers  the young volunteer who decamps to New Hampshire, knocking on doors, putting up signs.

title: Ex-Vice Presidents Review Is Full of Heart
description: When it comes to journalism, the former vice president Dan Quayle would probably rather be known for his familys onetime publishing empire than for his orthography (remember the potato incident). Now he can add the title of book reviewer to his rsum.

title: Magical Night for Rookie Pitcher
description: Tyler Clippard spent Saturday night at a hotel in New Jersey, and he planned to arrive at Shea Stadium at 4 p.m. yesterday. He expected snarled highways, and a car service picked him up at 2:30.

title: Buyout to Form Big Company to Train and Treat Prisoners
description: A company based in New Jersey that provides training and treatment programs to prison inmates is announcing today that it has bought a similar Massachusetts company, creating one of the largest correctional services companies in the country.

title: China to Buy a Stake in Blackstone
description: The Chinese government said yesterday that it would acquire a $3 billion stake in the Blackstone Group, the private equity firm, in the countrys first effort to diversify its $1.2 trillion in foreign-exchange reserves beyond United States Treasury bills and into commercial enterprise.

title: Verizon Consolidates Agencies and Adds Wireless Assignments
description: In one of the largest recent account consolidations, Verizon Communications is combining duties for its consumer and business services with assignments for Verizon Wireless to increase effectiveness and efficiency. Verizon, which spends about $1.9 billion a year on advertising, will reduce its agency roster to 10 from more than 20.

title: NATO Chief and Bush Meet at Ranch
description: CRAWFORD, Tex., May 20  President Bush welcomed the NATO secretary general to his home here on Sunday for two days of meetings focusing on holding together the fragile coalition fighting in Afghanistan and on dealing with new tensions with an assertive Russia.

title: Treasury Auctions Scheduled for This Week
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week included todays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills tomorrow.

description: Gov. Bill Richardson of New Mexico formally kicked off his bid for the 2008 Democratic presidential nomination today, highlighting his Hispanic roots and wealth of experience and issuing a forceful call to end American involvement in Iraq.

title: Confident Spurs Show Jazz What It Is Missing
description: SAN ANTONIO, May 20  Jerry Sloan, who has never had any use for excuses in his 19 years as the coach of the Utah Jazz, spit out a terse halftime speech that made no allowances for his players being young or afraid in the face of the San Antonio Spurs.

title: Corrections: For the Record
description: A front-page picture caption yesterday with an article about the crisis faced by Africas finest universities because of mismanagement, neglect and policies that favor basic education referred incorrectly in some copies to the broken piece of equipment being used by a chemistry student. It is a graduated cylinder, not a test tube. (Go to Article)

title: No Sign of Murdock or B.A. Baracus
description: Anyone watching the opening to Foxs telecast yesterday noticed that David Wright introduced the Mets starting lineup with a little flair. He assigned nicknames to everyone but himself: Carlos Mr. GQ Beltran, Shawn I Miss My Hair Green, Carlos Delgado  The Puerto Rican Mr. T, and so on. In case you were all wondering, yes, Wright thought of all of them himself. And he was pretty proud of them, too.

title: Relax, Breathe  the Yankees Win the Finale
description: First of all, thanks to everyone who responded to the last entry on how to fix the Yankees. Great insights, and a lot of funny ones, too. Keep those comments coming.

title: U.S. Championship, Round 6: Shabalov Express Is Derailed, but He Still Leads
description: Well, Alexander Shabalov will not win every game in the Frank Berry U.S. Championship. He wont even go undefeated. Alexander Onischuk, the defending champion, beat Shabalov and moved into second place, a half point out of the lead. Most of the other games on the top boards were drawn so there is a pack of seven players with 4 points, a point behind Shabalov. The games can be seen live or replayed here at Monroi.com.

title: Corrections: For the Record
description: An article on Wednesday about American adoptions from Guatemala incorrectly described the accreditation process for adoption service providers. The State Department contracts the process out to the Council on Accreditation; it does not itself accredit them.

title: Corrections: For the Record
description: An article on Wednesday about a transcript of a military hearing for Majid Khan, a terror suspect held at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, gave an incorrect number in some copies for the times that Mr. Khan said he cut and chewed an artery in his arm because he was so desolate. It was twice, not three times.

title: All You Need Is (the Summer of) Love
description: Note: This lesson was originally published on an older version of The Learning Network; the link to the related Times article will take you to a page on the old site.

title: No Man's Land
description: Other cities in Colombia have become secure and prosperous enough, but Buenaventura is a different story.

title: Chrysler Finds Itself in Phonetic Purgatory
description: Q: How do you pronounce DaimlerChrysler in German?A: Daimler. The Chrysler is silent.

title: Alltels $27.5 Billion Buyout Creates Static
description: Alltels agreement to go private in a $27.5 billion deal  the largest leveraged buyout ever in the telecommunications industry  is not sitting well with some of the other private equity firms who lined up to bid for the wireless phone company. The deal to be acquired by a consortium including the Texas Pacific Group and a unit of Goldman Sachs effectively short-circuits the auction process, in which other groups, such as the Blackstone Group with Providence Equity Partners, and the Carlyle Group with Kohlberg Kravis Roberts, had hoped to participate.
